progetto.network

Class AbstractRoom

  • java.lang.Object
    • progetto.network.AbstractRoom
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.lang.Runnable
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    Room, WaitingRoom

    abstract class AbstractRoom
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.lang.Runnable
    An abstract room is the class that holds the connections. Abstract room implements runnable, a new thread must be started When a player sends a request, this request is processed by the thread spawned. It ensures that request received by the same player are solved in order of arrival. It DOES not ensure that requests received by different player are solved in order of arrival.

        the synchronization object used in this room

      • getName

        final java.lang.String getName()
        Returns:
        the current name of this room.

      • processAllCommand

        private void processAllCommand()
        this method is where all requests are performed. This ensures the absence of threading errors when the abstract room is updated, but requires that all modification are made inside a roomRequest.

      • run

        public final void run()
        implementation of the runnable interface set the thread name to Room Thread
        Specified by:
        run in interface java.lang.Runnable

      • getPlayerFromID

        final Player getPlayerFromID(int id)
        returns the playerinfo related to the player inside this room.
        Parameters:
        id - the id of the player.
        Returns:
        null if there is no such player, its information otherwise.

      • enqueueAdd

        final void enqueueAdd(java.lang.String playerName,
                      ServerConnection connection)
        append a request to create a new player inside this room the next time all pending command are processed.
        Parameters:
        playerName - the name with which the player will be know inside this room
        connection - the id of the player that is trying

      • enqueueRemoval

        final void enqueueRemoval(int playerID)

      • addPlayer

        final void addPlayer(java.lang.String playerName,
                     ServerConnection handler)
        creates a new player inside this room, if such player does no exist. Triggers a playerJoinEvent.
        Parameters:
        playerName - the name of the new player.

      • removePlayer

        final void removePlayer(int playerID)
        remove a player from this room. Trigger a playerLeaveEvent if such player existed.
        Parameters:
        playerID - the player to be removed

      • getPlayerOfChair

        final Player getPlayerOfChair(int chairID)
        returns the player that is inside a particular chair
        Parameters:
        chairID - a number between 0 and MAX_CHAIR_NUMBER
        Returns:
        the player that is sitting in a particular chair, null if chairID is invalid or if nobody is sitting in that chair.

      • getPlayerCount

        final int getPlayerCount()
        Returns:
        the count of player inside this room. Returns observers as well.

      • getView

        RoomView getView()
        Returns:
        the view of this room

      • stop

        void stop()
        stops the room thread. Clean up will be executed when the room thread desires.

      • tearDown

        private void tearDown()
        closes all the player connections, calls onTearDown

        void broadcast(java.lang.String message)
        send a message to every player inside the room
        Parameters:

      • notifyChange

        void notifyChange()
        send to every player the new state of the room

      • processCommand

        abstract void processCommand(java.io.Serializable syncString,
                             int callerID)
        every derived class must implements how sync string are handled
        Parameters:
        syncString - the string that must be syncd
        callerID - the id of the player that send the string

      • onTearDown

        void onTearDown()
        called when the room is closing, it is called inside the room update thread, so every modification to the room is thread safe default implementation is do nothing, so there is no need to call super

      • sendMessage

        void sendMessage(int targetID,
                 java.lang.String message)
        send a message to a particular client
        Parameters:
        targetID - id of the target
        message - string to be sent
